name: allium-cepa-scallion
definition: Scallion is a bunch of young onion harvested before the bulb develops.
description:
Scallions are a member of the Allium genus, which includes garlic, onions, leeks, and shallots.

Scallions are young onions harvested when their tops are green and the underdeveloped bulbs are 15 millimeters or less in diameter.

A scallion is made up of a white base that has not fully developed into a bulb and long green stalks that resemble chives.

Allium species referred to as scallions have hollow, tubular green leaves growing directly from the bulb.

Although the term scallion is used for several different types of onions, the white base of true scallions has straight sides versus rounded.

There are usually short off-white root threads that protrude from the bottom of the white end. ​

Scallions are a source of folate, calcium, iron, potassium and manganese.

Flavonoids, carotenoids and some sulphur compounds are the phytonutrients found in scallions.

Scallion is low in sodium, and very low in saturated fats and cholesterol.

It is also a good source of magnesium, phosphorus and copper, and a very good source of dietary fiber and vitamin A, C, and K.

Both the white and the green parts are used in recipes and eaten both raw and cooked.

Scallions have a sweeter, milder flavor than mature onions and are a bit stronger than chives.

The white part has more flavor than the green leaves.

The tops of these green onions may be used as a substitute for chives in many recipes.

Although scallions may be cooked, either whole or chopped, they are perhaps most enjoyed fresh in salads, as crudites or as a last minute topper for sauces.

Since scallions are milder than onions they can be eaten raw in sandwiches.

These leaves are used as a vegetable; they are eaten either raw or cooked.

The leaves are often chopped into other dishes, in the manner of onions or garlic.

The entire onion, including the top, can be sliced and used raw in salads, as a garnish or cooked in stir fries.

Scallions can be used instead of onions in some recipes.

Scallions are a popular ingredient in Chinese and Mexican cooking and are often used as a garnish in a variety of recipes.

Scallions are highly perishable, so buy in small quantities.

Before storing scallions, remove the rubber band and rinse the bunch under cold water.

Pat dry with a paper towel and then wrap in a damp paper towel and place in a plastic bag.

The scallions will stay fresh in the vegetable drawer of the refrigerator up to three days.

contextual.caption: Scallions are harvested when young and before the white bulb has time to form properly and are tender and mild with a long white slender neck and hollow green tops.

featured.caption:
The difference between scallions and green onions is the age on harvesting.

You can identify them by their bulb. Scallions have the thinnest, usually no wider than the onion's stem, while green onions' bulbs are slightly larger.

An onionlike plant having a bulb that breaks up into separable cloves with a strong distinctive odor and flavor.
